title: Coup in Niger: neighboring Nigeria on the front line
description: President Bola Tinubu is staking his future by posing as the leading advocate of a return to constitutional order, given the multiple threats hanging over his country.

title: Police step up deadly raids in Brazil
description: In the space of a week, at least 45 people have been killed in police operations. A start contrast with President Lula's pledges on security.

title: The Japanese beach that could soon be covered in concrete
description: Japan's Katoku beach is being threatened by a seawall project that was designed to protect the beach's island, Amami-Oshima, from typhoons. The development plans are raising questions about the Japanese government's approach to the environment.

title: How dependent is France on Niger's uranium?
description: The military coup in Niger has raised concerns about uranium mining in the country by the French group Orano, and the consequences for France's energy independence.

title: Several Mali soldiers killed in 'jihadist' attack
description: Northern Mali has been racked by an insurgency since 2012 and the unrest has since spread to central areas and beyond to Burkina Faso as well as Niger.

title: Niger: West Africa delegation ECOWAS leaves without meeting junta leader
description: The delegation's departure came after the putschists announced that they had broken off military cooperation with France.

title: Canada's record-breaking fire season burns on
description: Thirteen million hectares of forest have already burned this year, twice as much as the previous record, and the CO₂ emissions generated have far surpassed those of previous years.

title: Russian opponent Navalny convicted of extremism and sentenced to 19 years in prison
description: Alexei Navalny has rejected all the charges against him as politically motivated and accused the Kremlin of seeking to keep him behind bars for life.

title: France in the year 1000, as seen through Pineuilh's chess pieces
description: 'An underground history of France' (9/12). On the site of an ancient dwelling dating back to the late 10th century, crockery, tools, weapons, board game pieces and a bushel have been found. They give us a snapshot of a peasant knight's life at the dawn of feudalism.

title: Niger coup: Junta digs heels in, denounces military agreements with France
description: With an ultimatum set for Sunday by neighboring ECOWAS countries to either reinstate President Mohammed Bazoum or face a military intervention, putschists have opened the way to an escalation with unpredictable consequences.

title: French TV network Canal+ criticized for complying with Myanmar censorship
description: The French group, one of the few international TV platforms present in Myanmar, is now obligated to send all its filming scripts to the junta's censorship committee.

title: Ukraine's ports on the Danube are Moscow's new targets
description: Since the Black Sea was blockaded, the ports of Reni and Izmail have become a vital place of trade with the outside world, in particular for the transport of grain. Russia's latest attack on Wednesday damaged 40,000 metric tons of grain.

title: India's Supreme Court suspends Rahul Gandhi's defamation conviction
description: The country's top court stayed opposition Congress party leader Rahul Gandhi's defamation conviction, enabling him to return to parliament and contest national elections next year.

title: The Mediterranean on fire and a rainy Paris: The reasons for France's weird summer
description: For the past three weeks, part of France has had dismal weather. This can be explained by a shift in the jet stream, but it does not call into question the reality of climate change.

title: Niger coup: Another defeat in the war on terrorism
description: The French army's predominantly military response to jihadism in West Africa has proven ineffective.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Rain causes setback for test Seine swimming event
description: A training session in the river on Friday for swimmers competing this weekend was canceled because the water quality dropped below acceptable standards.

title: Trump, arraigned, turns legal procedures into campaign arguments
description: The former US president pleaded not guilty to charges relating to his 'criminal scheme' to overturn the 2020 election, and called the proceedings a 'persecution of a political opponent.'

title: Niger coup: Grip tightens around former regime
description: A 'witch-hunt is only just beginning,' said a member of deposed President Mohamed Bazoum's entourage.

title: Côte d’Ivoire mourns its 'old man,' Henri Konan Bédié
description: A ten-day national mourning period has been declared, during which flags will be flown at half-mast. In Daoukro, the former president’s fiefdom, the whole town seems overwhelmed by mourning.

title: The Baltic Sea, NATO's new front line
description: The Baltic Sea is on the brink of a major geopolitical upheaval: Finland has just joined the Atlantic Alliance and Sweden is on its doorstep. Russia will soon find itself surrounded by eight NATO countries.

title: Niger: 'Coup leaders who stir up anti-French sentiment in the Sahel distract from France's real mistakes'
description: Amadou Sadjo Barry, international relations ethics specialist and professor of philosophy in Quebec, analyzes Niger's relationship and resentment towards the former colonial power.

title: Niger: Junta threatens immediate response to any 'aggression'
description: Ousted president Bazoum, who has been held by the coup plotters with his family, called on Thursday, August 3, for "the US government and the entire international community to help us restore our constitutional order."

title: Expelled Tennessee representatives win back their state House seats
description: Justin Jones and Justin Pearson had led protest chants from the House floor using a bullhorn on April 3, 2023, days after a gunman killed six people, including three children, in a Nashville school.

title: Six Mississippi policemen admit torturing Black men
description: The brutal assault, and its subsequent cover-up in which the men left one victim bleeding as they hid evidence of their crimes, is the latest race-tinged stain on US policing.

title: Mexican bus carrying migrants crashes, killing 18
description: Such crashes are a leading cause of death among migrants making the dangerous journey overland to the United States.

title: In Africa's Sahel region, French companies stand firm despite increasingly hostile climate
description: After the multiple coups that shook Mali, Burkina Faso, and now Niger, companies are trying to maintain their presence in these countries – even if the security climate continues to deteriorate.
